snippet: As a teacher and principal, Carmen Fariña became known for her hands-on approach, which propelled her rise in the Education Department of New York City and ultimately contributed to her departure.
abstract: Carmen Farina, New York City's new schools chancellor, became known throughout her 40-year career as teacher and principal for her hands-on and blunt management style; her hard-charging image propelled her to become a deputy chancellor in the Bloomberg administration, ultimately leaving amid differences over standardized testing and the overall direction of the system.

byline.original: By JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Vivian Yee contributed reporting, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: As a teacher and principal, Carmen Fariña became known for her hands-on approach, which propelled her rise in the Education Department of New York City and ultimately contributed to her departure.

headline.main: New York Schools Chancellor Honed Blunt Style Over 40 Years
headline.print_headline: No ‘Mary Poppins,’ School Chief Honed Blunt Style Over 40 Years
